title: Is JavaScript really the wild west?
body: They told us that JavaScript is the wild west and you can do anything you want, but it doesn't feel that way to me. What do you think?

title: Back end is more enjoyable than front end
body: On the back end you don't have to spend forever trying to perfect the appearance of a UI, and I don't miss that at all!

title: When did it stick?
body: When did JavaScript methods start to feel like handy tools you can utilize to accomplish something, rather than difficult concepts to try and learn?
